ability.name: Chain of Events
ability.text: As long as Plusle is your Active Pokémon, whenever your other Active Pokémon, if any, attacks, you may use Cheer On after the first attack (you still need the necessary Energy to use Cheer On). You can't use Cheer On more than once in this way even if your other Active Pokémon has the Chain of Events Poké-Body.

attacks.name: Cheer On
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Plusle).

attacks.name: Extra Circuit
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If you choose Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Wonder Guard
ability.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Shedinja by your opponent's Evolved Pokémon and Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Damage Curse
attacks.text: Put 1 damage counter, plus 1 more damage counter for each damage counter on Shedinja, on the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Intimidating Fang
ability.text: As long as Salamence is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Dragon Flame
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Salamence. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Energy Recall
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to Flaaffy.

attacks.name: Triple Smash
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Poison Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bubble
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Numel and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Ampharos ex

ability.name: Conductivity
ability.text: As long as Ampharos ex is in play, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card to his or her Pokémon from hand, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. You can't put more than 1 damage counter even if there is more than 1 Ampharos ex in play.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prizes instead of 1.

attacks.name: Gigavolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Rayquaza ex
text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prizes instead of 1.

attacks.name: Spiral Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza ex.

attacks.name: Dragon Burst
attacks.text: Discard either all Fire Energy or all Lightning Energy attached to Rayquaza ex. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fire or Lightning Energy discarded.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Leech Life
attacks.text: After your attack, remove from Nincada the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. If Nincada has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Horsea.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Rainbow Burn
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Flygon.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for Magikarp and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Breath
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Power Pinchers
ability.text: As long as Crawdaunt is your Active Pokémon, when any of your Active Pokémon does damage to the Defending Pokémon, the attack does 10 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

ability.name: Thick Skin
ability.text: Roselia can't be affected by any Special Conditions.

attacks.name: Speed Growth
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder

attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.

attacks.name: Scorching Smoke
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torkoal.

attacks.text: If Girafarig and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, pick any 1 card from your deck and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost to that Pokémon (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)"

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shelgon during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.text: If Vibrava has any basic Energy cards attached to it, Vibrava's Retreat Cost is 0.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.text: Any damage done to Pineco by attacks is reduced by 10. (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Balloon Berry
text: When the Pokémon Balloon Berry is attached to retreats, discard Balloon Berry instead of discarding Energy cards.
Attach Balloon Berry to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

cards.name: Energy Recycle System
text: Search your discard pile for basic Energy cards. You may either show 1 basic Energy card to your opponent and put it into your hand, or show 3 basic Energy cards to your opponent and shuffle them into your deck.

cards.name: High Pressure System
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each player pays Colorless less to retreat his or her Fire and Water Pokémon."

cards.name: Low Pressure System
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each Grass and Lightning Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) gets +10 HP."

cards.name: TV Reporter
text: Draw 3 cards. Then discard any 1 card from your hand.
You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prizes instead of 1.

attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prizes instead of 1.

attacks.text: Use any attack from Kingdra ex's Basic Pokémon card or Stage 1 Evolution card. (Kingdra ex doesn't have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Kingdra ex but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prizes instead of 1.

attacks.text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, choose a number of cards there, without looking, until your opponent has 5 cards left. Have your opponent discard the cards you chose.

attacks.name: Prize Count
attacks.text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Dragon Dance
attacks.text: During your next turn, if any of your current Active Pokémon does damage to any Defending Pokémon, the attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Active Pokémon.

ability.name: Dragon Wind
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Salamence is your Active Pokémon, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Salamence is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Air Slash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Flygon.

ability.name: Magnetic Field
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have basic Energy cards in your discard pile, you may discard any 1 card from your hand. Then search up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't return the card you first discarded to your hand in this way. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Magnetic Force
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon (including Magneton).

ability.name: Loose Shell
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Ninjask from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for Shedinja and put it onto your Bench. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Quick Touch
attacks.text: You may switch Ninjask with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, you may move any number of Grass Energy cards attached to Ninjask to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Pick On
attacks.text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, look at his or her hand. Choose a number of cards there until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand and have your opponent shuffle the cards you chose into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Power Count
attacks.text: Count the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon and all of your opponent's Pokémon. If your Pokémon have less Energy than your opponent's, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Quick Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance to Benched Pokémon.)

text: Attach Buffer Piece to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If that Pokémon is Knocked Out, discard this card.

Damage done to the Pokémon Buffer Piece is attached to by an opponent's attack is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). At the end of your opponent's turn after you played Buffer Piece, discard Buffer Piece.
